title: Telegram Founder Pavel Durov Announces New Crackdown On Illegal Content
content: Telegram founder and chief executive Pavel Durov said Monday that the messaging platform had removed more "problematic content", weeks after his arrest in France on charges of failing to act against criminals using the app.
summary: Telegram founder and chief executive Pavel Durov said Monday that the messaging platform had removed more "problematic content", weeks after his arrest in France on charges of failing to act against criminals using the app.

title: Taliban Restrictions On Women Jeopardise Afghanistan's Fight Against Polio
content: The Taliban's decision to halt door-to-door polio vaccinations in Afghanistan has jeopardized the nation's fight against the disease.
summary: The Taliban's decision to halt door-to-door polio vaccinations in Afghanistan has jeopardized the nation's fight against the disease.

title: 'Doomsday Glacier' Is Heading For Collapse Sooner Than Expected
content: The scientists predict that Thwaites Glacier and the Antarctic Ice Sheet could collapse within the next 200 years.
summary: The scientists predict that Thwaites Glacier and the Antarctic Ice Sheet could collapse within the next 200 years.

title: Witness In France Mass Rape Trial Breaks Down, Says "I Lived A Lie"
content: A former partner of a co-defendant in a mass rape trial that has sparked horror and protests in France broke down in tears on Monday, telling the court she had "lived a lie" and might herself have been sexually assaulted.
summary: A former partner of a co-defendant in a mass rape trial that has sparked horror and protests in France broke down in tears on Monday, telling the court she had "lived a lie" and might herself have been sexually assaulted.

title: After Deadly Strikes, Netanyahu's Message For Lebanese People: 10 Points
content: Hours after Israeli strikes killed nearly 500 people in Lebanon, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu reached out to the Lebanese people and asked them not to become "human shields" for the Hezbollah.
summary: Hours after Israeli strikes killed nearly 500 people in Lebanon, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu reached out to the Lebanese people and asked them not to become "human shields" for the Hezbollah.

title: Meta's AI Chatbot To Speak In Voices Of Judi Dench, John Cena, Among Others
content: Facebook owner Meta Platforms is planning to announce this week that it has secured deals with actors including Judi Dench, Kristen Bell and John Cena to give voice to its Meta AI chatbot
summary: Facebook owner Meta Platforms is planning to announce this week that it has secured deals with actors including Judi Dench, Kristen Bell and John Cena to give voice to its Meta AI chatbot

title: Bangladesh Army Chief Vows Support For Interim Government 'Come What May'
content: Bangladesh's army chief vowed to back the country's interim government "come what may" to help it complete key reforms after the ouster of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina so that elections could be held within the next 18 months.
summary: Bangladesh's army chief vowed to back the country's interim government "come what may" to help it complete key reforms after the ouster of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina so that elections could be held within the next 18 months.

title: PM Modi Departs For India Wrapping Three-Day "Successful" US Visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday left for home after wrapping up his "successful and substantial" three-day visit to the US.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday left for home after wrapping up his "successful and substantial" three-day visit to the US.

title: Mysterious 18th Century Necklace With 500 Diamonds Set For Auction
content: A mysterious 18th century necklace made from around 500 diamonds, some of which are believed to have been taken from a piece that contributed to Marie Antoinette's demise, will go on sale in November, Sotheby's said on Monday.
summary: A mysterious 18th century necklace made from around 500 diamonds, some of which are believed to have been taken from a piece that contributed to Marie Antoinette's demise, will go on sale in November, Sotheby's said on Monday.

title: Fake 'Brad Pitt' Scams Two Women In Spain Of 3,25,000 Euros, 5 Arrested
content: Spanish police said Monday that they had arrested five people accused of scamming two women of 325,000 euros by posing as the Hollywood star Brad Pitt via online and WhatsApp messages.
summary: Spanish police said Monday that they had arrested five people accused of scamming two women of 325,000 euros by posing as the Hollywood star Brad Pitt via online and WhatsApp messages.

title: California Passes Law To Ban Or Restrict Smartphones In School
content: California Governor Gavin Newsom signed into law on Monday a bill that requires schools to limit or ban the use of smartphones, amid a growing consensus that excess usage can increase the risk of mental illness and impair learning.
summary: California Governor Gavin Newsom signed into law on Monday a bill that requires schools to limit or ban the use of smartphones, amid a growing consensus that excess usage can increase the risk of mental illness and impair learning.

title: US' Phoenix Breaks Heat Record With 113 Days Straight Over 100 Fahrenheit
content: The desert city of Phoenix, Arizona, suffered a record 113 straight days with temperatures over 100 Fahrenheit (38 Celsius) this year, leading to hundreds of heat-related deaths and more acres burned by wildfire across the state, officials said.
summary: The desert city of Phoenix, Arizona, suffered a record 113 straight days with temperatures over 100 Fahrenheit (38 Celsius) this year, leading to hundreds of heat-related deaths and more acres burned by wildfire across the state, officials said.

title: In New York, Zelensky Thanks PM Modi For Peace Efforts In Ukraine Conflict
content: PM Modi, during his meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, affirmed that everyone agrees with need to reach a ceasefire in the ongoing conflict in Ukraine and the restoration of peace and stability, Foreign Secretary said on Monday.
summary: PM Modi, during his meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, affirmed that everyone agrees with need to reach a ceasefire in the ongoing conflict in Ukraine and the restoration of peace and stability, Foreign Secretary said on Monday.

title: Gunman Wrote Chilling Letter Months Ago About Assassination Bid On Trump
content: The gunman suspected of planning to kill Donald Trump wrote a chilling letter months ago about an  "assassination attempt" on the former president, US prosecutors said on Monday.
summary: The gunman suspected of planning to kill Donald Trump wrote a chilling letter months ago about an  "assassination attempt" on the former president, US prosecutors said on Monday.

title: 5.6 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Japan, Tsunami Warning Issued
content: A 5.6-magnitude earthquake struck near Japan's Izu Islands on Tuesday, the USGS said, triggering local weather authorities to issue a tsunami warning for the remote Pacific area off Tokyo.
summary: A 5.6-magnitude earthquake struck near Japan's Izu Islands on Tuesday, the USGS said, triggering local weather authorities to issue a tsunami warning for the remote Pacific area off Tokyo.

title: Lebanon-Israel Tensions Near "Full-Fledged War": EU Foreign Affairs Chief
content: EU foreign affairs chief Josep Borrell said on Monday that the escalating clashes between Israel and Lebanon's Iran-backed Hezbollah threaten to plunge the Middle East into all-out war.
summary: EU foreign affairs chief Josep Borrell said on Monday that the escalating clashes between Israel and Lebanon's Iran-backed Hezbollah threaten to plunge the Middle East into all-out war.

title: US, UAE Discuss Progress On India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor
content: Joe Biden and his counterpart from the UAE Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed discussed the progress of the landmark India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor (IMEC) and underscored its potential to usher in a "new era of international connectivity".
summary: Joe Biden and his counterpart from the UAE Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed discussed the progress of the landmark India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor (IMEC) and underscored its potential to usher in a "new era of international connectivity".

title: Zelensky Says Ukraine "Closer To End Of War" With Russia
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said that his country is "closer to the end of the war" with Russia, according to excerpts of an interview with ABC News released on Monday.
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said that his country is "closer to the end of the war" with Russia, according to excerpts of an interview with ABC News released on Monday.

title: US To Discuss "Concrete Ideas" With Allies To Prevent Israel-Hezbollah War
content: The U.S. does not support the escalation between Israel and Hezbollah across the border, a senior State Department official said, adding that Washington was going to discuss "concrete ideas" with allies and partners to prevent the war from broadening
summary: The U.S. does not support the escalation between Israel and Hezbollah across the border, a senior State Department official said, adding that Washington was going to discuss "concrete ideas" with allies and partners to prevent the war from broadening

title: Nearly 500 Killed In Israeli Strikes On Hezbollah Strongholds In Lebanon
content: Israeli air strikes on Lebanon killed at least 492 people on Monday, including 35 children, the health ministry said, marking the deadliest day of cross-border violence since the Gaza war began.
summary: Israeli air strikes on Lebanon killed at least 492 people on Monday, including 35 children, the health ministry said, marking the deadliest day of cross-border violence since the Gaza war began.
